description: This trap indicates that the MD5 authentication fails.
the information include local address, port,
remote address, port, protocol and VRF name.
When MD5 authentication fails, this trap will be sent.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-TCP-MIB::hwTCPMD5AuthenFail RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnLocalAddress a 192.0.2.1 RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnLocalPort i 9999 RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnRemAddress a 192.0.2.1 RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnRemPort i 9999 HUAWEI-TCP-MIB::hwTCPProtocol s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-TCP-MIB::hwTCPVrfName s EXAMPLE

description: The local IP address for this TCP connection. In the case
of a connection in the listen state willing to
accept connections for any IP interface associated with the
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnLocalAddress

description: The local port number for this TCP connection.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnLocalPort

description: The remote IP address for this TCP connection.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnRemAddress

description: The remote port number for this TCP connection.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::tcpConnRemPort

description: This variable indicates which protocol use MD5 authentication.
If protocol is BGP, this variable will be the BGP string;
If protocol is LDP, this variable will be the LDP string;
If protocol is unknown, this variable will be the Unknown protocol string.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TCP-MIB::hwTCPProtocol

description: This variable indicates which VPN the TCP connection belongs to.
If the TCP connection belongs to public net, this variable is null.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TCP-MIB::hwTCPVrfName
